DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to improve hospital treatment and rehabilitation of patients with hip arthroplasty to help the patients to regain functional ability in the shortest possible time, and reduce hospital and rehabilitation time to save costs for the patient and society. Optimal reconstruction of the hip joint and the effect of an intensive physical training programme are compared to conventional rehabilitation programmes.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment and Rehabilitation of Patients With Hip Arthroplasty to Regain Walk and Work Efficiency and Quality of Life
DOC.criteria: Primary osteoarthritis Unilateral osteoarthritis Age below 65 yrs ASA group 12 Pregnancy Age below 18 yrs Cardiovascular disease Diseases in the musculoskeletal system that could influence on training
